ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English 'partener' (partner) + suffix '-ship'. 'Partner' ultimately derives from Old French 'parçonier' meaning 'participant'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A legal agreement between two or more people to operate a business as co-owners; the state of being partners in a business.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 指两个人或更多人共同经营一项业务并作为共同所有人所达成的法律协议；在商业中成为合伙人的状态。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They formed a partnership to open a new law firm.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们建立了一个合伙企业来开一家新的律师事务所。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A relationship between individuals, organizations, or countries who work together; the state of being partners in a shared activity or goal.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 指个人、组织或国家之间为共同目标而合作的关系；在共同活动或目标中成为伙伴的状态。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The success of the project was due to the strong partnership between the two departments.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 该项目的成功归功于两个部门之间紧密的合作关系。
